methods.name: Stakeholder Round Table
methods.description: Convene multiple personas to contribute diverse perspectives - essential for requirements gathering and finding balanced solutions across competing interests

methods.name: Expert Panel Review
methods.description: Assemble domain experts for deep specialized analysis - ideal when technical depth and peer review quality are needed

methods.name: Debate Club Showdown
methods.description: Two personas argue opposing positions while a moderator scores points - great for exploring controversial decisions and finding middle ground

methods.name: User Persona Focus Group
methods.description: Gather your product's user personas to react to proposals and share frustrations - essential for validating features and discovering unmet needs

methods.name: Time Traveler Council
methods.description: Past-you and future-you advise present-you on decisions - powerful for gaining perspective on long-term consequences vs short-term pressures
methods.output_pattern: past wisdom > present choice > future impact

methods.name: Cross-Functional War Room
methods.description: Product manager + engineer + designer tackle a problem together - reveals trade-offs between feasibility desirability and viability

methods.name: Mentor and Apprentice
methods.description: Senior expert teaches junior while junior asks naive questions - surfaces hidden assumptions through teaching

methods.name: Good Cop Bad Cop
methods.description: Supportive persona and critical persona alternate - finds both strengths to build on and weaknesses to address

methods.name: Improv Yes-And
methods.description: Multiple personas build on each other's ideas without blocking - generates unexpected creative directions through collaborative building

methods.name: Customer Support Theater
methods.description: Angry customer and support rep roleplay to find pain points - reveals real user frustrations and service gaps

methods.name: Tree of Thoughts
methods.description: Explore multiple reasoning paths simultaneously then evaluate and select the best - perfect for complex problems with multiple valid approaches

methods.name: Graph of Thoughts
methods.description: Model reasoning as an interconnected network of ideas to reveal hidden relationships - ideal for systems thinking and discovering emergent patterns

methods.name: Thread of Thought
methods.description: Maintain coherent reasoning across long contexts by weaving a continuous narrative thread - essential for RAG systems and maintaining consistency

methods.name: Self-Consistency Validation
methods.description: Generate multiple independent approaches then compare for consistency - crucial for high-stakes decisions where verification matters

methods.name: Meta-Prompting Analysis
methods.description: Step back to analyze the approach structure and methodology itself - valuable for optimizing prompts and improving problem-solving

methods.name: Reasoning via Planning
methods.description: Build a reasoning tree guided by world models and goal states - excellent for strategic planning and sequential decision-making

methods.name: Red Team vs Blue Team
methods.description: Adversarial attack-defend analysis to find vulnerabilities - critical for security testing and building robust solutions

methods.name: Shark Tank Pitch
methods.description: Entrepreneur pitches to skeptical investors who poke holes - stress-tests business viability and forces clarity on value proposition

methods.name: Code Review Gauntlet
methods.description: Senior devs with different philosophies review the same code - surfaces style debates and finds consensus on best practices

methods.name: Architecture Decision Records
methods.description: Multiple architect personas propose and debate architectural choices with explicit trade-offs - ensures decisions are well-reasoned and documented

methods.name: Rubber Duck Debugging Evolved
methods.description: Explain your code to progressively more technical ducks until you find the bug - forces clarity at multiple abstraction levels

methods.name: Algorithm Olympics
methods.description: Multiple approaches compete on the same problem with benchmarks - finds optimal solution through direct comparison

methods.name: Security Audit Personas
methods.description: Hacker + defender + auditor examine system from different threat models - comprehensive security review from multiple angles

methods.name: Performance Profiler Panel
methods.description: Database expert + frontend specialist + DevOps engineer diagnose slowness - finds bottlenecks across the full stack

methods.name: SCAMPER Method
methods.description: Apply seven creativity lenses (Substitute/Combine/Adapt/Modify/Put/Eliminate/Reverse) - systematic ideation for product innovation
methods.output_pattern: S > C > A > M > P > E > R

methods.name: Reverse Engineering
methods.description: Work backwards from desired outcome to find implementation path - powerful for goal achievement and understanding endpoints
methods.output_pattern: end state > steps backward > path forward

methods.name: What If Scenarios
methods.description: Explore alternative realities to understand possibilities and implications - valuable for contingency planning and exploration

methods.name: Random Input Stimulus
methods.description: Inject unrelated concepts to spark unexpected connections - breaks creative blocks through forced lateral thinking

methods.name: Exquisite Corpse Brainstorm
methods.description: Each persona adds to the idea seeing only the previous contribution - generates surprising combinations through constrained collaboration

methods.name: Genre Mashup
methods.description: Combine two unrelated domains to find fresh approaches - innovation through unexpected cross-pollination
methods.output_pattern: domain A + domain B > hybrid insights

methods.name: Literature Review Personas
methods.description: Optimist researcher + skeptic researcher + synthesizer review sources - balanced assessment of evidence quality

methods.name: Thesis Defense Simulation
methods.description: Student defends hypothesis against committee with different concerns - stress-tests research methodology and conclusions

methods.name: Comparative Analysis Matrix
methods.description: Multiple analysts evaluate options against weighted criteria - structured decision-making with explicit scoring

methods.name: Pre-mortem Analysis
methods.description: Imagine future failure then work backwards to prevent it - powerful technique for risk mitigation before major launches

methods.name: Failure Mode Analysis
methods.description: Systematically explore how each component could fail - critical for reliability engineering and safety-critical systems

methods.name: Challenge from Critical Perspective
methods.description: Play devil's advocate to stress-test ideas and find weaknesses - essential for overcoming groupthink

methods.name: Identify Potential Risks
methods.description: Brainstorm what could go wrong across all categories - fundamental for project planning and deployment preparation

methods.name: Chaos Monkey Scenarios
methods.description: Deliberately break things to test resilience and recovery - ensures systems handle failures gracefully

methods.name: First Principles Analysis
methods.description: Strip away assumptions to rebuild from fundamental truths - breakthrough technique for innovation and solving impossible problems

methods.name: 5 Whys Deep Dive
methods.description: Repeatedly ask why to drill down to root causes - simple but powerful for understanding failures

methods.name: Socratic Questioning
methods.description: Use targeted questions to reveal hidden assumptions and guide discovery - excellent for teaching and self-discovery

methods.name: Critique and Refine
methods.description: Systematic review to identify strengths and weaknesses then improve - standard quality check for drafts

methods.name: Explain Reasoning
methods.description: Walk through step-by-step thinking to show how conclusions were reached - crucial for transparency

methods.name: Expand or Contract for Audience
methods.description: Dynamically adjust detail level and technical depth for target audience - matches content to reader capabilities

methods.name: Feynman Technique
methods.description: Explain complex concepts simply as if teaching a child - the ultimate test of true understanding

methods.name: Active Recall Testing
methods.description: Test understanding without references to verify true knowledge - essential for identifying gaps

methods.name: Occam's Razor Application
methods.description: Find the simplest sufficient explanation by eliminating unnecessary complexity - essential for debugging

methods.name: Trolley Problem Variations
methods.description: Explore ethical trade-offs through moral dilemmas - valuable for understanding values and difficult decisions

methods.name: Hindsight Reflection
methods.description: Imagine looking back from the future to gain perspective - powerful for project reviews

methods.name: Lessons Learned Extraction
methods.description: Systematically identify key takeaways and actionable improvements - essential for continuous improvement
